Title: DevOps, SAP & Data Analyst Bootcamp
Description: Berlian Sistem Informasi - Digital Bootcamp Program 2023 Data Analyst Bootcamp DevOps Bootcamp SAP FI Bootcamp SAP MM Bootcamp Description This program will gave you an opportunity to learn and be developed as professional IT consultant with direct exposure from our operation and project team. you could pick one of the three bootcamp with different passion & purpose; Bootcamp Business Analyst SAP, Bootcamp Software Engineer (Tester) & Bootcamp Data Analyst. Please state your bootcamp preferences in Email or Resume. You'll get to learn from our member and get used to technology that we do, such as SQL & Python for Data Analyst Bootcamp and DevOps Bootcamp, ERP & SAP MM or FI Module for Business Analyst SAP Bootcamp. Please complete your application by sending the following documents via Kalibrr message feature: Educational Certificate (Ijasah) Academic Transcript (Transkrip Nilai) ID Card (KTP) Only suitable candidates who meet the requirements will be contacted for further process Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree from Science, Technology or Engineering major with minimum GPA of 3.00. Fresh graduates Have interest and Passion in Data Science, SAP or DevOps area. Able to join as soon as possible Have strong analytical thinking & growth mindset Great communication skill in English and Bahasa. Willing to follow our Recruitment Process & Bootcamp Program. You will be required to do some several hiring process in Jakarta. Willing to be placed in Pulomas (Jakarta) for Data Analyst, SAP FI & SAP MM Bootcamp, and DevOps.

Title: Business Analyst for Financial Industry
Description: Bachelor Degree with minimum GPA of 3.0 (scale of 4.0) More than 2 years of experience as business analyst in financial industry Good understanding of financial industry business processes (banking, insurance and multi finance) Experience in conducting requirements gathering Familiar with Business Requirement and Functional Specification Design document Good understanding of SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) including Waterfall and Agile concept Familiar with Business Analyst tools and techniques Having knowledge in Database (for query purpose) is a plus Thorough and detail-oriented person Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong communication and presentation skills Good interpersonal and leadership skills Ability to independently learn new concepts/technology Fluent in English

Title: AI Business Analyst
Description: In this role, you will act as a bridge between domain/function and data scientists. Actively participating in the analysis of domain problems/needs and seeking suitable digitalization/ AI solutions. In your new role you will: Gather and translate requirements for functional solutions into clear AI scope and objectives. Develop and evaluate algorithms according to the expected problem solution. Harmonize business process/work method to enable analytics/ AI solutions into implementation. Prove concepts, prototypes, and implementations, mainly pertaining to the solutions and services in Business Analytics encompassing Computer Vision; Natural Language Processing; Reinforcement Learning; Machine learning & Deep Neural Networks; and Predictive & Prescriptive modeling. Collect, analyze, and interpret qualitative & quantitative data with statistical methods (e.g. data sampling/ re-sampling, ANOVA analysis, distributions, etc). Apply standard processes such as CRISP-DM (business understanding, data understanding, data preparation, modeling, evaluation, deployment); Machine Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, and PyTorch; and Agile Methodologies for Business Analytics projects. Create and review technical design documentation, research and proposals, white papers, presentations, formal recommendations, and reports.  You are best equipped for this task if you have: Master's / Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics. >3 years of relevant working experience in the semiconductor or electronics manufacturing industry. Understands complex issues and puts them in context. Hands-on working knowledge using Data Science and Statistical methods for AI / ML including Deep Learning methods (Convolutional Neural Networks, Recurrent Neural Networks, and Generative Adversarial Networks). Working experience in Text Mining and Natural Language Processing. Programming skills with scripting languages & frameworks such as Python, R, Matlab, Scala, Java, TensorFlow, and PyTorch. Familiar with microservice and/or big data technologies such as Openshift, Cloudera (CDH), Elasticsearch, and CEPH. Good knowledge of Agile Methodologies. Experienced in best practice adaption and external benchmarking. Strong proficiency in English with excellent communication and presentation skills.   Part of your life. Part of tomorrow. Infineon is a world leader in semiconductor solutions that make life easier, safer, and greener. Our solutions for efficient energy management, smart mobility, and secure, seamless communications link the real and the digital world.

Title: Consultant as Research Analyst for Papua (Jayapura based)
Description: Program Overview WRI Indonesia is an independent research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity, and human well-being. Within our Agriculture, Forest, and Land Use (AFOLU) Program, we envision critical ecosystems such as forests and peatland across Indonesia to be governed fairly and sustainably. We believe sustainable land use management is key for Indonesia to meet its climate goal, in line with keeping the global climate target below the 1.5-degree Celsius warming threshold, while providing sustainable livelihoods to forest-dependent communities and conserve biodiversity in the landscape. We work together with various levels of government, private sector, and civil society through research, policy advocacy, and creation of a community of practice to mainstream sustainable land use management. Papua and West Papua have unique geographical features being forest-dense provinces and socio-culturally different. Hence the need for WRI Indonesia to have a specific and relatively large autonomous office. Project portfolios in Papua and West Papua include, but not limited to: The Food and Land Use Coalition (FOLU) The Food and Land Use coalition (FOLU) is an initiative that focuses on an integrated, sustainable transformation of global food and land use systems to support delivery of global agreements including the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the Paris Climate Agreement. The approach will consider the many dimensions and perspectives of biodiversity, climate, agriculture and food production, rural prosperity, supply chain management, product formulation, diets, health and nutrition, loss and waste and security of supply. The project works under the umbrella of Indonesia’s Low Carbon Development Initiatives (LCDI), alongside its sistering initiatives such as Indonesia Intact Rainforest Partnership (IIRP), Food, Agriculture, Biodiversity, Land use, and Energy (FABLE) Consortium, and beyond. Indonesia Intact Rainforest Partnership (IIRP) As FOLU sister initiative, Indonesia Intact Rainforest Partnership aims to catalyze the implementation of a low-carbon development plan in four intact forest provinces, namely Papua, West Papua, North Kalimantan, and Aceh. It consists of policies, programs, and investments that advance local economic development, improve resident well-being, and avoid deforestation. Job Highlight The Research Analyst for Papua will be based in Jayapura to provide support in research, implementation of project activities plan, and stakeholder engagement of various project within Papua Region portfolio including but not limited to the briefly mentioned project. This position will report to the Project Lead and work collaboratively with Papua Regional teams and other project-related personnel. What You Will Do Research and Capacity Building Contribute to research project related to Papua Region portfolio. This includes research implementation, analysis, and report writing.  Contribute to the capacity building-related activities including but not limited to:  identify and verify the potential community groups to be assessed according to the needs of each project,  Actively involved on in planning, preparation, and implementation of any capacity building activities including the development of presentation material,  Produce activity report in a timely manner,  Facilitate discussions with targeted participants and other potential stakeholders.  Facilitate the establishment of an institutional mechanism and ensure its functions after the mechanism is formed.  Contribute on spatial analysis works including providing technical assistance to stakeholders Prepare and conduct data collection and data compiling.  Provide input to any knowledge and communications product undertaken by Papua Regional team.  Provide support to strengthen the quality of various research projects undertaken and/or coordinated by Papua Regional team.  Outreach and Stakeholder Engagement Build and maintain good relationships with various stakeholders such as universities, local governments, regional partner institutions, and local communities who work on issues of forestry, environment, management of natural resources, and carbon finance in Eastern Papua Provinces (Papua, Papua Selatan, Papua Pegunungan, and Papua Tengah) especially Jayapura and Merauke Districts.  Participate in discussions, meetings, conferences.  Identify potential stakeholders to expand engagement work whenever necessary.  What You Will Need Legally able to work in Indonesia.  Willing to work in Jayapura, Papua Province as an office base. Local candidates are encouraged to apply.  Bachelor’s degree in development study, community development, sociology, natural resources management, environmental studies, or a related field required.  3+ years of professional working experience in strengthening empowerment, working with rural communities and/or other relevant stakeholders.  Familiarity in processing spatial data using GIS software (e.g., ArcGIS) to produce high quality spatial analysis and reports.  Proven experience in engaging with various types of stakeholders, especially those within the Papua region.  Ability to setting priorities.  Good verbal and written communication skills both in English and Indonesia for correspondence purposes, reports, and knowledge products.  Willing to do travel.  Fluency in Microsoft Office Suite.  Performance Standard Responsibilities are expected to be carried out in a timely and satisfactory fashion with minor supervision.  Deliverables Comprehensive monthly report that consists of achievement, work progress, and lesson learned, including but not limited to: Research and assessment activities including spatial analysis works  Capacity-building activities Outreach and engagement activities Duration April – December 2023 Terms of Payment Daily rate-based consultant with maximum of 18 working days per month in average Contract Arrangement Individual consultancy contract (Part-time, limited term) What we offer: Consultant rate that is commensurate with experience and skills  Travel insurance for both domestic and international for any travel duty as assigned by WRI Indonesia  Access to the WRI global network A workplace that strives to put diversity and inclusion at the heart of our work  Must have authorization to work in Indonesia to be eligible for this position. Final candidates might be required to take a writing test and to produce two writing samples when needed. How to apply: In order to be formally considered, please submit an updated resume and cover letter through WRI career portal. Application close: 1700 (DKI Jakarta local time), 10 April 2023. We will close the advert earlier when the best candidates are identified at earlier dates. This is a locally engaged position; Indonesian nationals are encouraged to apply. About Us Founded in 1982, World Resources Institute (WRI) is an independent, nonprofit global research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity, and human well-being. We are working to address seven critical challenges that the world must overcome this decade to secure a sustainable future for people and the planet: climate change, energy, food, forests, water, sustainable cities, and the ocean. WRI has a global staff of over 1,800 people with work spanning 60 countries. We have offices in Africa, Brazil, China, Europe, India, Indonesia, Mexico, Colombia and the United States, as well as a growing presence in other countries and regions.   The foundation of our work is delivering high-quality research, data, maps, and analysis to solve the world’s greatest environment and international development challenges and improve people’s lives. We work with leaders in government, business, and civil society to drive ambitious action and create change on the ground. Equally important, we bring together partners to develop breakthrough ideas and scale-up solutions for far-reaching, enduring impact. Our mission and values: WRI’s mission is to move human society to live in ways that protect Earth’s environment and its capacity to provide for the needs and aspirations of current and future generations. Our values are shared ideals that bind us together: Integrity, Innovation, Urgency, Independence, Respect. Our culture: WRI is committed to advancing gender and social equity for human well-being in our mission and applies this principle to our organizational and programmatic practices. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment, we embrace all diversity and encourage women, the LGBTQ+ community, persons with disabilities, Afro-descendants, and Indigenous people to apply. Recognizing our strong commitment to gender equality, WRI has also been awarded EDGE certification. WRI Indonesia is national entity (Yayasan) associated with the World Resources Institute (WRI), a global environmental research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity, and human well-being. WRI work with various stakeholders in the natural resources sector to support policy and management that are both profitable and sustainable. WRI work with leaders in more than 50 countries for more than 30 years, with offices in Brazil, China, Europe, India, Indonesia, Mexico, and the United States. Launched in early 2014, WRI Indonesia builds on WRI’s 10-year history in the country, and strengthens our impact on the ground. In the short-to-medium term, WRI Indonesia aims to expand its presence and portfolio to include projects in the climate, energy, as well as city and transportation programs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Work alongside other teams and clients to understand client challenges, and requirements and articulate business and technology solutions. Collaborate with technical architects, product owners, and subject matter experts to ensure the right solution with the right budget and delivery characteristics is achieved Be part of project delivery team on solution implementation project as solution architect and/or technical consultant. Provide technical support and assistance if necessary to client to ensure smooth operation of the solution after implementation. Coordinate with the sales and other presales teams to deliver workshops, proposals, presentations, etc. (including Requests for proposals, requests for information, idea and solution generation, road-map creation, and more) Minimum Qualifications Minimum of Bachelor's Degree (S1 Degree) in Informatics or Mathematics or other related major At least 3 years of experience as data analyst or data engineer Good communication in English both written and spoke Skills Required: database programming, data cleaning and preparation, data analysis and exploration, statistical knowledge, creating data visualisations, creating dashboards and reports Strong understanding of data platform technologies such as RDBMS, Big Data/Hadoop, ETL/data pipelines and data analysis tool (such as PowerBI, Tableau or Qlik) either on prem or cloud based; experience in using Azure Data platform is a plus. Strong problem solving, conceptual and analytical thinking, and desire to learn new technologies Comfortable with handling clients & prospects

Title: Senior Cyber Security Operation
Description: Who are we? Amar Bank is one of the most technologically advanced digital banks in Indonesia. Our leading digital lending product, Tunaiku has the distinction of being the first FinTech product in Indonesia. We are also the first digital bank on the cloud. As the first profitable digital bank, we managed to get listed on the Indonesian Stock Exchange. How did we manage to do that? We are changing people’s perception of a bank. We believe we are the innovators who combine customer focus principles with creating technology-based impact. We incorporate freedom and flexibility as part of our startup working culture DNA to encourage innovation in creating better financial solutions for the banking industry. We think of ourselves as, ‘A technology company with a banking license’. For this reason, we ‘Act like a FinTech, and think like a Bank.’ How did it all start? Founded on March 15, 1991, in Surabaya as PT Anglomas International Bank (Amin Bank), the bank was acquired by Tolaram Group and transformed to PT Bank Amar Indonesia (Amar Bank) in 2014. It has then undergone a significant digital transformation to become one of the country's forerunning fintech institutions through its award-winning digital lending platform, Tunaiku. Our philosophy, mission, and vision Technology must impact lives, must improve lives. We exist to provide banking to those who ‘need’ and not only to those who ‘want’. Services when provided to those who need at the time of their need brings smiles. Our vision is to bring 200 million smiles. More about the bank with startup culture environment Consist of 1000+ people, you will meet people who love to grow, dream big, and actually have fun at the workplace! We provide a great working environment that pushes people to grow outside their comfort zone. People with high drive and ambition find us a very attractive place to work as their career growth matches their own drive and not any staid policies. Thus we hold the honor of being awarded “Best Place to Work in Indonesia”. Recently Amar Bank was awarded as Inspirational Brand from APEA (Asia Pacific Enterprise Awards) 2022. Of course, our innovation won't stop here. So if you would love to be a part of it, have a growth mindset, and are constantly hungry for challenges, we invite you to join us in our journey to ‘Impact Lives’. Join us today and create #unlimitedinnovations! Cyber Security Operation is part of the cyber security team, and reporting to the cyber security operation team lead. You will operate and manage defensive and monitoring security technology, and make sure the security of our product by doing security assessment regularly. Communicate and collaborate with Engineers and Product Owners to maintain security level resilience of the products and assets. This role will handle most of our process improvement, handling requests from other teams regarding process, handling various communication regarding fixing and patching, and being involved in internal processes like pentest and incident response. Responsibilities Performing Pentest and Vulnerability Assessment Manage, operate and optimize security operation tools alert and vulnerability assessment tools result Analyze potential incident and vulnerability from various incoming channel Being part of security incident and response team, to respond, analyze and process incidents according to the SLA Conduct, Analyze and Enhance any of existing cybersecurity operation related process, documentation and report Manage VAPT and Cyber Security related engagement process with various parties Achieving personal/team KPI with minimum supervision Requirements At least 5 years of Cyber Security career related experience, preferable in security operations and analyst Passionate about Cyber Security trends and technology Experienced in using security monitoring and protection technology (SIEM, Scanner tools, Cloud and Container security tools) Experienced in analyzing security scanner results, giving recommendation, and do a followup process for vulnerability mitigation Experienced in analyzing potential incident log to determine course of actions on how to handle them Have strong analytical skill, creative and critical thinking is a must Having solid communication and presentation skill is a must Bonus point if Experienced in Financial or Startup industry Hold any Cyber Security related certification Familiar with cloud and container environment Familiar with Prisma Cloud, Wazuh, SOCRadar, Burp Suite, Defectdojo We exist to innovate and maintain the architecture of Amar Bank's products. As part of our main focus to create through technology we ensure the process and technology we use helps maintain and build human connection at scale. It’s our job to plan, monitor, and control the technology growth so we can provide a faster, more convenient, and more efficient way of performing business transactions.

Title: Regional Credit Underwriting Head
Description: We are looking for an experienced Regional Credit Underwriting Head to determine our customers’ creditworthiness and you will analyze financial data to assess the likelihood of a borrower honouring their financial obligations. You will also lead a newly acquire Multifinance company as part of the ecosystem. Responsibilities Reviews customer application to give credit recommendation that can maximize portfolio return, minimize potential credit loss to the lending business Become highest layer to loan approval and responsible for making recommendations to the borrower for new, renewal and extension loans to approve or deny the extension of credit Designing and driving implementation of credit strategies, policies, procedures and guidelines together with risk management to support business growth with healty credit portfolio Develop and implement early warning detection and proactive stress testing strategies in underwriting process to detect deterioration in portfolio quality Creating key operational matrix in underwriting and operation unit including measuring capacity planning, productivity, SLA and TAT as per comitted time Have extensive knowledge about various types of businesses, financial statement, risk process so that able to give feedbacks on current policy and propose solution to close that gaps Lead operation support to achieve best efficient and cost effective operating models with still managing the credit risks and fraud risks.  Requirements Having experience in lending business of financial institution with minimum 5 years, related with underwriting, credit analyst and credit operation is a must. Have extensive knowledge in underwriting methodology and best practice on Showroom/Dealer refinancing business and Consumer Finance loan (passenger and commercial car) is a must. At least a Bachelor’s Degree from top local or overseas universities with excellent GPA. Postgraduate/MBA degree and consulting experience is a plus. Advanced in Microsoft Excel skills, MS Word and Power point is a must and high understanding of financial statement and business process Have sound knowledge in credit risk principles and credit loss concept and best practice applied to car lending and commercial loan Proven track record of performing highly in previous role(s) and able to make sound credit decision Care about doing an excellent job and exceeding expectations with the quality of what you do in fast paced environment Solid oral and written communication skills (both English and Indonesian) and able to communicate every policies and analysis to varied audiences including to whole lending team Experience in managing big team with pro-active mindset and problem solving

Title: Linux System Support Engineer
Description: CCC Operation System Support Analyst Reporting to:  CCC Operations Manager, DKI Global CCC Base Location:  Business office of Diamond Key International (Malaysia) Sdn. Bhd. in Mutiara Damansara, Petaling Jaya, Malaysia. Key Responsibilities:  System Support Analyst role is to provide highly effective global support functions towards Diamond Key International Group (DKIG) customer base. The role also has accountability for maintaining a good customer support experience and promoting value added services towards the customer.  This purpose is expected to be achieved through successful performance in the following Key Responsibility Areas (KRAs): 1. Actively involved in customer facing support function to effectively support all components of Terminal Automation System (TAS) and ensure full functionality. 2. Actively involved in 24 x 7 rotating shift support system providing mission critical operational, maintenance and technical support services for customers globally. 3. Effective and efficient first point of contact for customers seeking technical assistance over the phone, email or any other communication channel. Excellent customer service skills to meet and exceed customers’ expectation will be critical element.  4. Taking ownership to troubleshoot and resolve customer’s technical issues up to the resolution point. Update ICRM database with customer details and issue tickets for each call. Escalate technical issues to more senior-level support when required.  5. Management of recorded ICRM tickets being, new tickets or resolved / unresolved tickets associated to individual customer SLA / KPI agreements and report. This will include escalation of any unresolved issue to the next level within preset procedure.  6. Maintaining accurate records of customer service actions, customer sites configurations and equipment installed to support with analysis work that will enable value added recommendation towards the customer. 7. Commercially focused in CCC revenue maintenance and expansion by: • Analyzing customer site journal and reports for repetitive events or alarms impacting on the operations, efficiency (or other) of a Terminal. Present findings to Supervisor and Customer Account Manager for presentation to customer for preventative or value added services.  • Delivery of On-Line user training sessions covering awareness of DKI software application products, solutions and services. 8. Supporting ad-hoc resource requirement for project deliveries. 9. Other duties as may be reasonably agreed with the CCC Leadership Team taking into account the skills and competencies of the incumbent. Role Competencies:  Qualifications:  • A recognized Certificates, Diploma or Degree in IT, Electrical Engineering with at least 1 year experience • Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply • English, Malay  • Unix / Linux / HTML5 / Oracle Database / C ++ / JavaScript’s/ Networking / Cyber Security knowledge will be added advantage • Working knowledge of customer service software, database and tools • Must be able to work on shift & Public Holidays • Customer oriented with good interpersonal and communication skills • Passionate and enthusiastic about customer service • Effective team player with pleasant disposition and personality Experience / Personal Requisites: • Call centre experienced  • Remote technical support experience • Knowledge in Unix or Linux  • Ability to read and write scripting • Good communication skills Business Travel: The job role will require often travel locally, inter-province and from time to time internationally. Estimated percent of job role for travel is up to 50% though this may vary at company discretion. Travel time, in certain instances may include weekends. All business travel is subject to company policy at all times.

Title: Business Analyst for Financial Industry
Description: Bachelor Degree with minimum GPA of 3.0 (scale of 4.0) More than 2 years of experience as business analyst in financial industry Good understanding of financial industry business processes (banking, insurance and multi finance) Experience in conducting requirements gathering Familiar with Business Requirement and Functional Specification Design document Good understanding of SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) including Waterfall and Agile concept Familiar with Business Analyst tools and techniques Having knowledge in Database (for query purpose) is a plus Thorough and detail-oriented person Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong communication and presentation skills Good interpersonal and leadership skills Ability to independently learn new concepts/technology Fluent in English

Title: Business Data Analyst - Investment Tech of Big Conglo
Description: Flexible working arrangement|Stability (big conglo company) About Our Client Client is an investment tech under one of the biggest conglo in Indonesia. Job Description  Drive the decision-making across business depts based on data.  Uncover hidden sources of value within the client's business, and make recommendations out of it when applicable by proactive approach on ad-hoc/deeper data investigations or trend analysis  Create, maintain, and monitor reliable and scalable reports and dashboards across client's BI tools (i.e. BigQuery, Tableau, etc)  Have an understanding and ability to stitch between behavioral and transactional users' data in doing forecasting & planning The Successful Applicant  Have an Undergraduate degree in related subjects (IT, Mathematics, etc.)  Experienced for at least 3 years in Data Analysis & Insight  Preferably have led or mentor a small team (around 3 headcounts)  Experienced in big data processing with SQL, Python/R, as well as making dashboards and reports  Have deep curiosity and proactively explore more business insights What's On Offer Flexible working arrangement, stability (conglo-backed company), collaborative team member and mentor Contact: Clairine Lonteng Quote job ref: JN-012023-5921314
